metadata.title: CVE-2020-13935 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The payload length in a WebSocket frame was not correctly validated inApache Tomcat 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M6, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.36, 8.5.0 to 8.5.56and 7.0.27 to 7.0.104. Invalid payload lengths could trigger an infiniteloop. Multiple requests with invalid payload lengths could lead to a denialof service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13935` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.37-3
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9 - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-common - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.37-3
tomcat9-user - 9.0.37-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.0.37-3').
